qas.question: When did the tradition of people carrying the Olympic torch before the Olympic games begin?
How many days did people carry the Olympic torch before the 2008 Summer Olympics?
What was the theme for the torch relay?
What did the organizers of the torch relay call it?
Where were the details of the torch relay made known?
What was the torch relay referred to as by organizers?
How many miles was the Olympic torch relayed?

context: The 2008 Summer Olympics torch relay was run from March 24 until August 8, 2008, prior to the 2008 Summer Olympics, with the theme of "<a2_0><a4_0>one world, one dream<a4_0/><a2_0/>". Plans for the relay were announced on April 26, 2007, in <a5_0>Beijing, China.<a5_0/> The relay, also called by the organizers as the <a6_0>"<a3_0>Journey of Harmony<a3_0/>"<a6_0/>, lasted <a1_0>129 days<a1_0/> and carried the torch 137,000 km (<a7_0>85,000 mi<a7_0/>) – the longest distance of any Olympic torch relay since the tradition was started ahead of the <a0_0>1936 Summer Olympics.
